channel.title: Chapters on Trauma Book Club
channel.description: Recent content in Chapters on Trauma Book Club

item.title: Chapter1
item.description: Complex PTSD - Chapter 01 Definition Of Complex PTSD CPTSD is environmentally caused, not genetically. It is a learned set of maladaptive responses and a failure to complete numerous developmental tasks. This means that the behaviours/symptoms/maladaptations can be “unlearned”. The book is oriented towards "the most prevalent kind of CPTSD". Thus focuses on healing damage from abuse and abandonment that is rooted mostly in childhood trauma and abuse/neglect Recovery has crucial self-help and relational components.
